title: Rod Stewart goes to 'Another Country'
text:
Rod Stewart goes to 'Another Country' Jeffrey Lee Puckett , @JLeePuckett 1:13 p.m. EDT October 19, 2015 Vintage Vinyl | Rod Stewart's best and worst Rod Stewart performs at the KFC Yum! Center in Louisville. June 3, 2014. (Photo: Jessica Ebelhar) CONNECT 2 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Rod Stewart returned to songwriting with 2013's "Time," which had some pretty good material and was welcomed warmly, and he maintains his run with “Another Country.” It isn't an attempt to cash in on country music, so it's already a winner. 
“When my last album was so well-received, it gave me the confidence to keep on writing, and to examine and write about different things,” Stewart said in a press release. “It also gave me the freedom to experiment with different sounds like reggae, ska and Celtic melodies.” 
Some of the experiments don't work, and there are definitely some awkward moments, but it's a likable album. The deluxe edition's adds a few songs, including "In a Broken Dream,” a 1968 hit made with Australian rock band Python Lee Jackson. 
Also out this week: Rock/pop — Joanna Newsom, one of indie music's most celebrated and indescribable artists, returns after five years of acting and performing with “Divers”; Judith Hill, one of the unheralded backup singers featured in “20 Feet From Stardom,” debuts with the Prince-produced “Back in Time.” 
Pop heartbreakers 5 Seconds of Summer return with “Sounds Good Feels Good”; Depeche Mode singer Dave Gahan has a new solo record, “Angels & Ghosts," with his band the Soulsavers, 
Harry Connick Jr. collaborated with producers Eg White and Butch Walker on “That Would Be Me,” which is said to be a departure for the veteran crooner; and speaking of crooning, Andrea Bocelli offers “Cinema,” a collection of songs from movies. 
Vanessa Carlton, “Liberman”; Matthew Sweet and Susanna Hoffs, “Completely Under the Covers,” is a four-CD set collecting all three of their celebrated cover albums, with 15 bonus tracks. 
“Cold and Bitter Tears: The Songs of Ted Hawkins” pays tribute to a greatly underrated writer and singer, with covers from Kasey Chambers,Mary Gauthier, James McMurtry, Gurf Morlix, Tim Easton and Sunny Sweeney; Shawn Mullins, “My Stupid Heart.” 
Killing Joke, “Pylon”; Vinnie Moore, “Aerial Visions”; Like Moths to Flames, “The Dying Things We Live For”; Pure Bathing Culture,“Pray For Rain”; Half Moon Run,“Sun Leads Me On." 
R&B/hip-hop — Gilla Da Kid, "Welcome 2 Gilladelphia"; DJ Khaled, "I Changed A Lot"; Wax, "Livin' Foul." 
Country/bluegrass — Carrie Underwood, “Storyteller”; Kyle Park, “The Blue Roof Sessions.” 
Jazz — Kenny Burrell, “The Road to Love.” 
Blues — Walter Trout, “Battle Scars”; Tommy Castro & The Painkillers, “Method to My Madness.” 
Christmas — Band of Merrymakers, “Welcome to Our Christmas Party,” with 3OH!3, Christina Perri, Dan Wilson, Mark McGrath, Nick Hexum and Owl City, among others; Chris Tomlin, “Adore: Christmas Songs of Worship”; The Claire Lynch Band, “Holiday!” 
Reporter Jeffrey Lee Puckett can be reached at (502) 582-4160 and jpuckett@courier-journal.com. Read or Share this story: http://cjky.it/1RS8JOm TOP VIDEOS
